item.title: What is "Communication Plan"
item.description:
In the “Project Management” Course, one of the topics is “Communication Plan”.

When the phrase “communication plan” is used, I feel it is pretty clear what should I do to sell the product and have better connection with the users, and among the developers.

Communication plans can help you clarify the purpose of a product launch or new initiative and officially determine the messages you want to deliver to your intended audience(s).

item.title: Project technology selection (tcl-csh-cli)
item.description: In this post, I would like to talk about my view on technology selection. When we talk about VLSI CAD (not EDA), most people will think about CS background, coding ability, etc. But I want to think out of box, as a project manager, I can not just pick option 1 or option 2. It is always good to use SME (Subject Matter Expert) tool. So we may need to group a team with option 1 and option 2 mixture.

item.title: Use tree command to list the structure
item.description: tree command is helping to show the structure of folders and files. Real Case When discussing the folder structure via video meeting, express the structure is a little bit challenge if we have a lot of levels and files. How to make the folder and file structure clear when we present something? . means in current dir. and we can use pwd to replace it. ➜ tree -a --dirsfirst . ├── test -> test_3 ├── test_1 │ └── file_1 ├── test_2 │ └── file_2 ├── test_3 │ └── file_3 └── .

item.title: English pronunciation helper, youglish.com
item.description: This is a website to help on the English pronunciation. Youglish : https://youglish.com The website will pick a lot of youtube videos which includes the words we searched. You will see it shows up 1951 videos and now is currently playing the 4th one. This is quite useful because not like the dictionary, the video will not only tell you how the word is pronounced, but also tell you when it is used via video, not just a sentence.

item.title: Collection to Notion Inbox
item.description: I have tried many different tools to organize the information collected online. The services like raindrop.io, App List, cubox, etc. They all have their own use cases and scenarios. And Cubox can support tags, date, sort, and other more functions. Comparing to these apps, Notion is a good replacement which can serve the collection very well. Result This is the view for my current inbox (Table View). The links are added to the inbox by sharing function from my iPhone when I browse the technical articles or news.
